* J SC refers to "Short-Circuit Current Density," another property in the context of photovoltaic devices.

J SC (Short-Circuit Current Density) is not a material property, but rather a property related to the performance of a photovoltaic device. Therefore, it is not included in the table.

Here, "moderate EQE" and "J SC" are the identified "Property Value" entities. "EQE" stands for external quantum efficiency, a figure of merit used in photodetector and solar cell research. "J SC" likely refers to short-circuit current density, another important parameter in solar cell research.

| moderate EQE |

After reevaluating the original paragraph, only "moderate EQE" (external quantum efficiency) clearly refers to a value of a material property. "J SC" (likely short-circuit current density) is not a material property value in this context, but rather a parameter used in the context of solar cells.
